channel.title: Dan Friedman's Data Science Knowledge Base

item.title: Correlation Does Not Imply Causation
item.description: Understand what is correlation in statistics and how to interpet this statistic
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Independent Samples t-tests
item.description: Simple example in Python using NumPy and SciPy to walk through steps of independent sample t-tests
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Dependent Samples t-tests
item.description: Simple example in Python using NumPy and SciPy to walk through steps of dependent samples t-tests
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Measures of Effect Size for t-tests
item.description: Simple example in Python using NumPy and SciPy to walk through cohen's d and r-squared measurements to measure effect size for t-tests
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: T-Tests: Intro to Key Terms & One Sample t-test
item.description: Learn about t-tests at a high level, the t-distribution, how to calculate t-critical values, degrees of freedom and an overview of the three types of tests. Example of one sample t-test. Lessons in Python and use statistical packages.
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Type I and Type II Errors in Hypothesis Testing
item.description: Learn about decision errors in statistical hypothesis testing and how to interpret them through several simple examples
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Intro to Hypothesis Testing and z-tests
item.description: Learn how to setup hypothesis tests and validate if a single sample parameter is significantly different than the population parameter and the hypothetical true parameter for z-tests
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: When to Use a Cumulative Frequency Graph
item.description: Explanation of cumulative graphs to illustrate the significance of trends relative to a total value
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Bessel's Correction
item.description: Understand the significance of Bessel's correction in calculating sample variance and sample standard deviation; visualize the bias in using the population standard deviation equation for samples
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman
